meanings.definition: Lacking in originality or freshness; trite.
meanings.sent1: The movie's plot was so banal that I could predict every scene.
meanings.sent2: Her banal outfit consisted of jeans and a plain white t-shirt.
meanings.sent3: The banal jokes at the party made everyone yawn.
meanings.sent4: The speaker's banal speech fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The banal music playing in the elevator put me to sleep.

meanings.sent1: The town's banal architecture lacked any unique charm.
meanings.sent2: She lived a banal life, following the same routine every day.
meanings.sent3: The banal weather forecast predicted another sunny day.
meanings.sent4: His banal taste in art only included mass-produced prints.
meanings.sent5: The banal conversation at the bus stop was forgettable.

meanings.sent1: The lecture was so banal that students started dozing off.
meanings.sent2: The book's banal plot failed to capture my interest.
meanings.sent3: The banal party had no entertainment, just awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: His banal expression showed no emotion or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The banal landscape outside the window was uninspiring.
